subject: Personal Finance
title: Representativeness Bias
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Representativeness Bias.

hook.text: A tech company with a cool logo and hip office must be a great investment, right? Not necessarily.

buildup.text: Representativeness bias means judging things by how much they resemble a familiar pattern.

discovery.text: Investors assume a company that looks like past winners will also win. Pattern matching trumps analysis.

twist.text: This bias fueled the dot-com bubble. Every website looked like the next Amazon â€” until 95% failed.

climax.text: A plain-looking company with boring products can be a far better investment than an exciting one.

punchline.text: Looking like a winner doesn't make you one.

quiz.question: What is representativeness bias?
options: Judging by resemblance to familiar patterns
